latestVersion.termsOfAccess: Please contact corresponding author for access.

fields.value: Replication Data for: Exposure to Ideologically Diverse News and Opinion on Facebook

dsDescriptionValue.value:
Replication Data for: Exposure to Ideologically Diverse News and Opinion on Facebook.

This archive includes:
  • R analysis code and aggregate data for deriving the main results (e.g., Table S5, S6)
  • Python code and dictionaries for training and testing the hard-soft news classifier
  • Aggregate summary statistics of the distribution of ideological homophily in networks.
  • Aggregate summary statistics of the distribution of ideological alignment for hard content shared by the top 500 most shared websites.

See README.html for a complete description of each file.

publicationCitation.value: Exposure to Ideologically Diverse News and Opinion on Facebook. E. Bakshy, S. Messing, L. Adamic, Science 10.1126/science.aaa1160 (2015).

files.description: `ApplySVM.py` reads in data on url-shares and classifies article/page content as "hard" news or "soft," based on sparse features from the accompanying text snippet.  This code requires model output from `FitSVM.py` to vectorize and classify the new content.
files.label: ApplySVM.py

dataFile.description: `ApplySVM.py` reads in data on url-shares and classifies article/page content as "hard" news or "soft," based on sparse features from the accompanying text snippet.  This code requires model output from `FitSVM.py` to vectorize and classify the new content.

files.description: `FitSVM.py` reads in data URL metadata and fits a model of whether article/page content is "hard" news or "soft," based on sparse features from the accompanying text snippet (usually a summary of the article/page content).  The model employed is a linear support vector classifier implemented in Scikit-learn.
files.label: FitSVM.py

dataFile.description: `FitSVM.py` reads in data URL metadata and fits a model of whether article/page content is "hard" news or "soft," based on sparse features from the accompanying text snippet (usually a summary of the article/page content).  The model employed is a linear support vector classifier implemented in Scikit-learn.

files.description: CSV file with aggregate statistics about the proportion of links to friends of different ideological affiliations, for liberal, moderate, and conservative users.
files.label: homophily_density.tab

dataFile.description: CSV file with aggregate statistics about the proportion of links to friends of different ideological affiliations, for liberal, moderate, and conservative users.

files.description: R analysis procedure for producing the main results of the paper (uses pimpd.Rda and vpvd.Rda).
files.label: main_analysis.R

dataFile.description: R analysis procedure for producing the main results of the paper (uses pimpd.Rda and vpvd.Rda).

files.description: This R data table summarizes the number of cases in which an individual could potentially be exposed to URLs shared by friends ('potential impressions'), whether they saw these stories in their News Feeds, and/or clicked on the link.
files.label: pimpd.Rda

dataFile.description: This R data table summarizes the number of cases in which an individual could potentially be exposed to URLs shared by friends ('potential impressions'), whether they saw these stories in their News Feeds, and/or clicked on the link.

files.description: Average domain-level URL alignment, and breakdowns of the proportions of articles classified as very liberally aligned, liberally aligned, bipartisan, conservatively aligned, and very conservatively aligned.  This includes the top 500 most shared domains (based off of URLs classified as 'hard content' by US users)
files.label: top500.tab

This includes the top 500 most shared domains (based off of URLs classified as 'hard content' by US users)

files.description: This R data table contains aggregate summaries of interactions with content that appeared in viewers' News Feeds.
files.label: vpvd.Rda
